name: Brocard's problem
summary: Brocard's problem is an unsolved number theory problem that asks for all integer solutions to the equation \(n!+1=m^{2}\). It was independently posed by Henri Brocard in 1876 and Srinivasa Ramanujan in 1913. The only known solutions are the pairs \((n,m)=(4,5)\), \((5,11)\), and \((7,71)\). It is unknown if any other solutions exist.Â
